item.title: 澳大利亚 Aware Super 公司收购价值 13 亿美元的美国仓库交易
item.description: Aware Super 收购了与 Goodman Group 成立的新合资企业 49% 的股份，该合资企业将投资价值 13 亿美元的一揽子美国工业地产，其中包括亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc.【原文：Aware Super has bought a 49% stake in a new venture with Goodman Group to invest in a $1.3 billion package of US industrial properties that count Amazon.com Inc. among their tenants.】

item.title: 因美国关门忧虑 黄金刷新纪录突破 3,800 美元
item.description: 由于美国政府即将关门的前景给美联储在下月利率决定前的货币政策走向蒙上了阴影，黄金一路走高，创下新纪录。【原文：Gold edged higher to a fresh record as the prospect of a looming US government shutdown clouded the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy path ahead of next month’s interest-rate decision.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利和 KKR 押注韩国租房者的历史性变化
item.description: KKR & Co.和摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）正在抓住韩国价值 1530 亿美元的住宅租赁市场数十年来最大的转变，这给全球机构带来了难得的机遇。【原文：KKR & Co. and Morgan Stanley are pouncing on the biggest shift in decades in South Korea’s $153 billion residential rental market that’s presenting a rare opportunity to global institutions.】

item.title: 关税之后，印度降息重启：政策指南
item.description: 印度储备银行周三的利率决定很可能是一次千钧一发的决定，决策者面临着多种降低借贷成本的理由，因为通胀率持续走低，经济增长受到美国高关税的冲击。【原文：The Reserve Bank of India’s interest rate decision on Wednesday will likely be a close call, with policymakers facing multiple reasons to lower borrowing costs as inflation stays low and economic growth takes a knock from high US tariffs.】

item.title: 受美国关税拖累，日本产出连续第二个月下降
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）持续发起关税运动，全球前景不明朗，企业保持谨慎，日本 8 月份的工厂产出连续第二个月下降。【原文：Japan’s factory output fell for a second month in August as businesses remained cautious amid a murky global outlook as a result of US President Donald Trump’s ongoing tariff campaign.】

item.title: 监督机构就私人资产报告警告澳大利亚养老基金
item.description: 随着澳大利亚 4.3 万亿澳元（约合 2.8 万亿美元）的养老金行业加大对非上市投资的风险敞口，澳大利亚企业监管部门警告该国的养老基金加强对私人资产及其估值的披露。【原文：Australia’s corporate watchdog has warned the nation’s pension funds to strengthen disclosure around private assets and their valuations as the A$4.3 trillion ($2.8 trillion) industry ramps up its exposure to unlisted investments.】

item.title: 人工智能芯片初创公司 Rebellions 以 14 亿美元的估值获得融资
item.description: Rebellions Inc. 从包括 Arm Holdings Plc 在内的投资者那里筹集了 2.5 亿美元，用于大规模生产其芯片，并在竞争激烈的人工智能市场上加快产品开发。【原文：Rebellions Inc. raised $250 million from investors including Arm Holdings Plc to mass produce its chip and speed up product development in a competitive AI market.】

item.title: 石油供应前景黯淡，加沙战争有望结束，石油跌幅扩大
item.description: 石油连续第二个交易日走低，因为市场权衡了即将出现的供应过剩和加沙敌对行动结束的可能性，这可能会从油价中抽走一些战争溢价。【原文：Oil pushed lower for a second session as the market weighed a looming glut and the possibility for an end to hostilities in Gaza, which could siphon some of the war premium out of prices.】

item.title: 黑客窃取联邦紧急事务管理局、海关和边境保护局员工数据
item.description: 今年早些时候，一名黑客进入联邦紧急事务管理局的计算机网络长达数月之久，并窃取了联邦紧急事务管理局和美国海关与边境保护局员工的信息。【原文：A hacker gained access to the Federal Emergency Management Agency’s computer networks for several months earlier this year and stole information about FEMA and US Customs and Border Protection employees, according to an overview of the incident.】

item.title: 额外成本负担导致英国商店价格通胀创 19 个月新高
item.description: 英国商店的价格通胀率升至 19 个月来的最高水平，因为消费者在结账时要为一系列新税买单，这些新税增加了零售商的成本。【原文：Price inflation in British shops rose to its highest level in 19 months, as consumers pay at the checkout for a slew of new taxes that have ramped up retailers’ costs.】

item.title: 紫金黄金 5 月以来最大规模全球首次公开募股后将在香港上市
item.description: 紫金黄金国际股份有限公司（Zijin Gold International Co.【原文：Zijin Gold International Co. will start trading in Hong Kong on Tuesday after the international unit of China’s biggest miner raised $3.2 billion in the world’s largest initial public offering since May.】

item.title: 调查称中国股市涨势将因人工智能贸易拥挤而降温
item.description: 市场观察人士表示，随着估值的拉伸，中国股市近期的势头可能会在年底前减弱，这使人们对人工智能突破和扶持政策将推动股市持久反弹的乐观情绪蒙上阴影。【原文：Chinese stocks’ recent momentum may taper by year-end as valuations stretch, market watchers say, clouding optimism that AI breakthroughs and support policies will drive a lasting rebound.】

item.title: 巴拿马运河为托运人提供更灵活的预订系统
item.description: 巴拿马运河管理局正在为托运人提供一个更灵活的水道通行预订系统，以便客户能更好地根据不断变化的市场条件安排过境。【原文：The Panama Canal Authority is offering shippers a more flexible system for booking passage through the waterway so that customers can better align transit with changing market conditions.】

item.title: 美国关门在即，亚洲股市看涨：市场综述
item.description: 在华尔街股市小幅上涨之后，亚洲股市表现低迷，原因是人们对美国政府即将关门的担忧加剧，因为这有可能延误对美联储政策决定至关重要的劳动力市场数据。【原文：Asian stocks looked muted after modest Wall Street gains, as concerns mounted over a looming US government shutdown that threatens to delay labor-market data key to Federal Reserve policy decisions.】

item.title: 特朗普将在政府关门期间继续进行关税调查
item.description: 在政府可能关门期间，特朗普政府将继续对某些进口产品进行调查，从而为进一步征收关税奠定基础。【原文：The Trump administration will carry ahead with investigations into certain imports during a possible government shutdown, allowing them to move forward on laying the groundwork for further tariffs.】

item.title: 人工智能数据中心让电费飙升
item.description:
在数据中心附近地区，批发电价比五年前高 267%。这些成本都转嫁给了客户。【原文：

Wholesale electricity costs as much as 267% more than it did five years ago in areas near data centers. That’s being passed on to customers.

】

item.title: Verizon 正在洽谈购买 EchoStar 无线频谱
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Verizon 通信公司正在与 EchoStar 公司讨论购买其部分无线频谱的事宜。【原文：Verizon Communications Inc. is in discussions with EchoStar Corp. about purchasing some of its wireless spectrum, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 强大的鸭子》男主角在离职前几天给了亚当斯一百万美元
item.description: 支持纽约市长埃里克-亚当斯（Eric Adams）的超级政治行动委员会（Super-PAC）获得了布洛克-皮尔斯（Brock Pierce —）的巨额捐款。【原文：A super-PAC backing New York Mayor Eric Adams got a hefty donation from Brock Pierce — a child-actor-turned-Bitcoin-investor — five days before the embattled politician ended his campaign.】

item.title: S&P称有望将电子艺界降至垃圾级
item.description: S&P全球评级公司表示，预计在这家视频游戏制造商的收购交易完成后，将把Electronic Arts Inc.的信用等级降至垃圾级，理由是该交易预计将增加约200亿美元的债务。【原文：S&P Global Ratings said it expects to cut Electronic Arts Inc.’s credit grades to junk status after the video-game maker’s buyout deal is closed, citing the expected addition of about $20 billion of debt from the transaction.】

item.title: 谷歌将支付 2450 万美元以结束特朗普就 1 月 6 日禁令提起的诉讼
item.description: 根据一份法庭文件，谷歌同意支付 2450 万美元，以解决唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）关于在 2021 年 1 月 6 日美国国会大厦骚乱后被禁止访问其 YouTube 频道属于非法审查的指控。【原文：Google agreed to pay $24.5 million to resolve Donald Trump’s claims that being banished from his YouTube channel after the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the US Capitol was illegal censorship, according to a court filing.】

item.title: 机器人顾问公司 Wealthfront 提交首次公开募股申请，显示利润下降
item.description: 在众多金融科技公司寻求期待已久的上市之际，机器人顾问公司 Wealthfront Corp.【原文：Wealthfront Corp., a robo-advisory firm, filed publicly for an IPO amid a slew of fintech companies pursuing long-awaited listings.】

item.title: Verdane 为最新的欧洲增长基金融资 20 亿欧元
item.description: 欧洲中低端市场投资公司 Verdane 为其最新的成长基金筹集了 20 亿欧元（23 亿美元），达到了最初的筹资目标。【原文：Verdane, a lower mid-market European investment firm, has raised €2 billion ($2.3 billion) for its latest growth fund, meeting its initial fundraising target.】

item.title: 赛勒对 "战略 "公司股价溢价的缩小不以为意
item.description: 迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）并没有让他的数字资产财务公司 Strategy Inc.【原文：Michael Saylor isn’t letting the diminishing premium his digital-asset treasury firm Strategy Inc. has long enjoyed over its Bitcoin holding distract him.】

item.title: 为什么美联储基金利率可能与市场脱节？
item.description: 美联储今年 9 月首次下调关键利率后，政策制定者们开始权衡降低美国借贷成本的利弊，一个新的问题开始变得紧迫起来：央行是否首先瞄准了正确的基准利率。【原文：As policymakers weigh the merits of lower US borrowing costs after the Federal Reserve cut its key interest rate in September for the first time this year, a new question is starting to gain urgency — whether the central bank is targeting the right benchmark rate in the first place.】

item.title: 盖蒂阻止债权人抵制与合并相关的债券交易
item.description: 图片供应商盖蒂图片控股公司（Getty Images Holdings Inc.这一过程包括争取投资者参与债券交易，为现有债务再融资。【原文：Stock photo supplier Getty Images Holdings Inc. is getting its ducks in a row to finance its acquisition of Shutterstock Inc. Part of the process includes cornering investors to participate in a bond exchange that would refinance its existing debt.】

item.title: 特朗普称内塔尼亚胡同意加沙和平计划，谢克尔跳水
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普称本雅明-内塔尼亚胡总理同意结束加沙战争的 20 点计划后，以色列货币对美元汇率升至三年多来的最强水平。【原文：Israel’s currency rose to its strongest level versus the dollar in more than three years after US President Donald Trump said Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu agreed to a 20-point plan to end the war in Gaza.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会的阿特金斯将与 CFTC 的加密货币合作视为 "当前的头号工作
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会主席保罗-阿特金斯（Paul Atkins）周一表示，协调加密货币规则是华尔街主要监管机构的首要任务。【原文：Coordinating cryptocurrency rules is the top task for key Wall Street regulators, US Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Paul Atkins said Monday.】

item.title: Optus 紧急呼叫失误增加，新加坡电信压力增大
item.description: 随着 Optus 又一次因紧急电话中断而陷入困境，危机已经蔓延到澳大利亚境外。这家澳大利亚第二大电话公司声誉受损的程度不断升级，其母公司新加坡电信有限公司（Singapore Telecommunications Ltd.）也受到了影响。【原文：As Optus reels from another emergency call outage, the crisis has bled beyond Australia’s borders. The escalating reputational damage to the nation’s second-largest phone company is now bearing down on its parent Singapore Telecommunications Ltd.】

item.title: 预测市场交易增长，Robinhood 股价攀升 12
item.description: Robinhood Markets Inc. 首席执行官弗拉基米尔-特涅夫（Vladimir Tenev）表示，该在线股票经纪公司已强势进军预测市场，人们在预测市场上就选举、体育比赛和其他广受关注的事件下注，之后该公司股价上涨超过 12%。【原文：Robinhood Markets Inc. shares rose over 12% after Chief Executive Officer Vladimir Tenev said the online-stock brokerage has made strong inroads into prediction markets, where people wager on elections, sporting matches and other widely followed events.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦称法国债务威胁经济发展
item.description: 法国央行行长表示，法国必须克服政治僵局，以解决债务负担可能使经济窒息的问题。【原文：France must overcome its political impasse to tackle a debt burden that risks suffocating the economy, the head of the country’s central bank said.】
